TEXT.English: Expert Poultry Breeder:Expert Poultry Breeders
Expert Poultry Breeder:Expert Poultry Breeders

Poultry farmers raise chickens, ducks, turkeys and geese for meat and eggs. Children can look after a pen with few chickens. When the flock gets bigger wolves and bobcats discover an opportunity, so poultry breeding turns into an adult job.

Chickens are an excellent food source. They travel well so they often provide the first domestic protein in a new colony.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Poultry Farmer profession, the expert is capable of producing double the poultry in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Cassava Planter:Expert Cassava Planters
Expert Cassava Planter:Expert Cassava Planters

Cassava roots are a staple food in tropical and subtropical climates. Cassava can be either sweet or bitter, with the bitter more pest-resistant. Proper preparation is important to avoid the risk of acute cyanide intoxication.

Cassava is drought-resistant. It grows on marginal soils. It's usually boiled, but the starch can be extracted for tapioca. In Brazil it's grated and dried into a coarse flour.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Cassava Planter profession, the expert is capable of turning out double the amount of cassava in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Cochineal Collector:Expert Cochineal Collectors
Expert Cochineal Collector:Expert Cochineal Collectors

The cochineal insects found on prickly pear cactus pads produce carminic acid, a predator-deterring chemical. When mixed with aluminum or calcium salts cochineal becomes carmine dye. Collectors gather the bugs by brushing them off the cactus pads.

Bright red carmine dye, used in the Americas for colouring fabrics, became an important export good in the 16th century. Cochineal insects are found in the areas now known as Peru, Mexico, Chile and Argentina.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Cochineal Collector profession, the expert can gather double the quantity of cochineal in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Flax Planter:Expert Flax Planters
Expert Flax Planter
Linen fabrics woven from wild flax date back over 30,000 years. Devout colonists all know that linen is frequently mentioned in the Bible.

Linen is comfortable to wear in hot weather. The fabric is strong and absorbent, though it does wrinkle.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Flax Planter profession, the expert can harvest double the quantity of flax in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Logwood Collector:Expert Logwood Collectors
Expert Logwood Collector:Expert Logwood Collectors

The logwood tree was of great economic importance in the colonial era when it was exported to Europe for dyeing fabrics. Defying Spanish territorial claims, foreign sailors cut and collected trees for shipment back to Europe. Spain responded by commissioning privateers to attack them.
TBD
TEXT.German: Under attack from Spanish privateers, logwood cutters formed their own pirate crews to raid the Spanish. Blackbeard turned captured logwood sloops into pirate ships.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Logwood Collector profession, the expert can cut down twice as much logwood in the same time it would take a regular colonist.

TEXT.English: Expert Olives Planter:Expert Olives Planters
Expert Olives Planter:Expert Olives Planters

Olive trees produce either table olives or olives for oil. Spanish colonists brought the olive to the New World in 1560, where its cultivation prospered in present-day Peru, Chile, and Argentina. In the 18th century Spanish missionaries planted olive trees in California.[NEWLINE]Before European contact cooking oil was essential for Pacific Northwest Native nations. Candlefish oil was so central to Native commerce that the trade routes were called grease trails.

The olive is a small tree originating in the Mediterranean basin. Olives are one of the core ingredients in Mediterranean cuisine. The olive tree has thousands of cultivars.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Olive Planter profession, the expert can gather double the olives in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Peanut Planter:Expert Peanut Planters
Expert Peanut Planter:Expert Peanut Planters

Peanuts are legumes farmed for their edible seeds. They're widely grown in the tropics and subtropics by both small and large commercial producers. The peanut is both a grain legume and, due to its high oil content, an oil crop.

Boiled peanuts are a popular snack in the areas where they're grown. They can be used to treat malnutrition and are especially important for feeding slave populations. Peanuts are usually roasted before being shipped.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Peanut Planter profession, the expert can gather double the peanuts in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.
Expert Peat and Clay Cutter:Expert Peat and Clay Cutters
Expert Peat and Clay Cutter:Expert Peat and Clay Cutters

A swamp dries and very slowly turns into a peat bog, which offers cheap fuel where wood and coal aren't available. Peat cutters don't need much equipment to do their work, just a cutter and a hod to carry chunks of peat on their back.

Peat is a peasant fuel, warming the poor and slaves at low or no cost. Peat is the world's most efficient carbon sink, storing 42% of all soil carbon, more than all other vegetation types, including the world's forests. It's not renewable.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Peat Cutter profession, the expert can cut twice as much peat in the same amount of time as a regular colonist.
Expert Rape Planter:Expert Rape Planters
Expert Rape Planter:Expert Rape Planters

Rapeseed with its bright yellow flowers is cultivated mainly for its oil-rich seed, which has appreciable amounts of erucic acid. Rapeseed meal, left after the oil is extracted, is a high-protein animal feed.

Rapeseed is a valuable oil crop. Once the oil is extracted, what's left is used as fodder for domestic animals, mainly cattle, but also pigs and poultry. It's a member of the cabbage family.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Rapeseed Planter profession, the expert can harvest double the rapeseed in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Rice Farmer:Expert Rice Farmers
Expert Rice Farmer:Expert Rice Farmers
In tropical areas rice can survive as a perennial. It grows in water. Rice seeds are milled with a huller to remove the chaff, producing brown rice. Removing the bran creates white rice.

Rice is nutritious and light to carry. Scouts may have a loaf of bread for their first day on the trail but it's the bag of dried rice that feeds them for the rest of the trip.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Rice Farmer profession, the expert can grow double the rice in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Vanilla Collector:Expert Vanilla Collectors
Expert Vanilla Collector:Expert Vanilla Collectors
Vanilla is a spice derived from orchids. There are three major species, all derived from the original Mexican plant. It can be pollinated by hand to produce the vanilla bean.

Vanilla is one of the two most popular flavours for sweet treats, the other being chocolate. It's used in candy, baking and liqueurs, all of which would be familiar to monks in colonial missions.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Vanilla Collector profession, the expert can gather twice as many vanilla beans in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Yerba Planter:Expert Yerba Planters
Expert Yerba Planter:Expert Yerba Planters

The Guaraní and Tupí cultivated yerba mate prior to European colonization. After the Jesuits started using it, yerba mate became widespread in what's now Paraguay and throughout other Spanish colonies.

Yerba leaves are steeped in hot water to make a caffeinated beverage: yerba mate. Brewed cold, it is used to make tereré.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Yerba Planter profession, the expert can get twice as many yerba leaves in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Herder:Expert Herders
Expert Herder:Expert Herders
Herding flocks is ancient. Biblical shepherds carried slings which they used to kill lions and Philistines, so herders in the New World were already well-prepared for wolves and bears.

Cattle graze the tops of grass stalks. so they can use the same field for years. Sheep eat the whole grass plant down to the root, leaving pastures barren. The result can be a range war.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Herder profession, the expert can raise twice as many animals in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Maple Tree Tapper:Expert Maple Tree Tappers
Expert Maple Tree Tapper:Expert Maple Tree Tappers

In spring when sap starts to flow in the maple forests, tappers hammer spouts through the bark and collect a thin fluid that's then distilled over a slow fire into a rich thick syrup. The sap can also be poured on snow to make maple sugar.

Maple syrup comes from maple forests which grow in north temperate regions. It's a popular treat, contributing to happiness.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Maple Tree Tapper profession, the expert can get twice as much maple syrup in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Rubber Collector:Expert Rubber Collectors
Expert Rubber Collector:Expert Rubber Collectors
Rubber is harvested by making incisions in the bark of rubber trees. The latex is heated to create rubber that can be dried into waterproof sheets, along with other industrial products.

Rubber has a large stretch ratio, high resilience and is also water-proof. It's classified as an elastomer.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Rubber Collector profession, the expert can get twice as much rubber in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Confectioner:Master Confectioners
Master Confectioner:Master Confectioners

A confectioner turns plantation sugar into a high-value product by flavouring it - perhaps with chocolate or vanilla. It's important to grind the sugar fine so that the candy has a smooth consistency.

The confectioner creates variety, candy for every taste, alongside traditional sweets that remind people of home. The business can become a social destination, with tables and beverages to accompany the treats.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Confectioner profession, the master can make twice as much candy in the time a regular colonist would take to do the job.
Master Household Goods Trader:Master Household Goods Traders
Master Household Goods Trader:Master Household Goods Traders

Housewares encompass everything that makes life comfortable, extending from basic necessities to rare luxuries. At first everything comes from Europe but clever artisans soon learn to make, and sometimes improve, familiar items.

Pots and pans are important trade goods. The houseware trader is expected to have all the necessities in stock at a fair price.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Household Trader profession, the master can handle twice the goods in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Yerba Tea Trader:Master Yerba Tea Traders
Master Yerba Tea Trader:Master Yerba Tea Traders

Getting started in the yerba trade meant dealing with two especially dangerous Indigenous nations: the Guaraní and Tupí. To add to the challenge, yerba was found in only two regions, Amambay and Alto Paraná.

Yerba leaves are steeped in hot water to make a caffeinated beverage: yerba mate. Brewed cold, it is used to make tereré.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Yerba Trader profession, the master can market twice the quantity of yerba leaves in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Cooking Oil Trader:Master Cooking Oil Traders
Master Cooking Oil Trader:Master Cooking Oil Traders

Pressing oil is an ancient craft in Europe, particularly in Mediterranean cultures. Olives are crushed for their oil. Once rapeseed oil is extracted, what's left is used as fodder for domestic animals, mainly cattle, but also pigs and poultry.

Cooking oil is used in most households almost every day. Because the market is so widespread it's a good cover for smuggling. Nostalgic settlers often prefer the taste of oil from their home country.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Cooking Oil Trader profession, the master can sell twice as much cooking oil in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Fruit Picker:Expert Fruit Pickers
Expert Fruit Picker:Expert Fruit Pickers
Fresh fruit is essential for good health. Fruits mature in different seasons, giving people a feeling for nature. Knowing the right moment to capture a crop's ripeness means getting the best price.

Fruit picking is one of the most laborious jobs available, what with climbing and stooping, but without pickers good food rots. It's usually a first job for immigrants and young people, and they move on to something less strenuous at the first opportunity.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Fruit Picker profession, the expert can harvest twice as much fruit in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Poultry Butcher:Master Poultry Butchers
Master Poultry Butcher:Master Poultry Butchers

Butchers use sharp knives and they have to work fast so it's a dangerous job. Poultry is tricky because not only do the carcasses have to be cleaned and the meat portioned, but the feathers and down, particularly from geese and ducks, must be plucked for insulation.

Poultry is usually the cheapest domestic meat in any settlement. A good butcher works fast and keeps the price down. Workers who don't get paid much still can eat well and the result is a busy happy community.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Poultry Butcher profession, the master can get twice as much meat and feathers in the same time as a regular colonist.
Expert Coal Miner:Expert Coal Miners
Expert Coal Miner:Expert Coal Miner

Coal is formed when dead plant matter decays into peat and is converted into coal by the heat and pressure of deep burial over millions of years. During colonial times coal is used for heating, not for industry.

Coal mining causes premature death and illness, but it's a soft rock that doesn't need as many explosives as hard rock mining. It's a job where labourers use picks and shovels, and they don't get paid much.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Coal Miner profession, the expert can get twice the tonnage of coal in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Leather Clothier:Master Leather Clothiers
Master Leather Clothier:Master Leather Clothiers
Sewing padding and a lining into leather doesn't just make the garment more comfortable. By adding insulation it also improves health for those working outside, and can even save their lives.

The clothing business has efficiencies and economies of scale. A solitary leather clothier might spend days fitting a coat to a single customer but a factory can have enough sizes in stock for everyone to buy off the rack.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Leather Clothier profession, the master can produce twice as much leatherwear in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Tailor:Master Tailors
Master Tailor:Master Tailors

The tailor's shop includes sub-trades. The cutter seldom sews the garment. Another chooses the perfect fabric. In a growing town with a fashionable tailor, everyone from the merchant to the blacksmith buys there to look their best.

The tailor creates the well-dressed man, stylish and ready to succeed at diplomacy, business and romance.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Tailor profession, the master can complete twice the clothes in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Roaster:Master Roasters
Master Roaster:Master Roasters

After the coffee berries are picked, the green coffee is processed by the wet method, where berries are fermented to produce a mild coffee.[NEWLINE]Beans are sorted for ripeness and the flesh of the beans is removed.[NEWLINE]Beans are then fermented to remove the oily mucilage.[NEWLINE]When fermentation is finished, the beans are washed with lots of fresh water to remove the fermentation residue, causing massive amounts of coffee wastewater.[NEWLINE]Finally the seeds are dried.
TEXT.French: Après la cueillette des baies de café, le café vert est traité par la méthode humide, où les baies sont fermentées pour produire un café doux. Les grains sont triés en fonction de leur maturité et la chair des grains est retirée. Les grains sont ensuite fermentés pour éliminer la couche visqueuse de mucilage encore présente sur le grain. Lorsque la fermentation est terminée, les grains sont lavés et séchés. Ils sont ensuite triés en fonction de leur maturité et de leur couleur. Le plus souvent, la chair de la baie est enlevée, généralement par machine, et les graines - généralement appelées haricots - sont fermentées pour enlever la couche visqueuse de mucilage encore présente sur le haricot. Lorsque la fermentation est terminée, les grains sont lavés avec de grandes quantités d'eau douce pour éliminer le résidu de fermentation, ce qui génère des quantités massives d'eaux usées de café. Enfin, les graines sont séchées.
TEXT.German: Nach dem Pflücken der Kaffeebeeren werden diese fermentiert, um die schleimige Schicht, die sich noch auf der Kaffeebohne befindet, zu entfernen. Ist die Fermentation beendet, werden die Bohnen gewaschen und getrocknet. Danach werden sie nach Reifegrad und Farbe sortiert und meist maschinell das Fruchtfleisch der Beere entfernt. Die Kerne - meist Bohnen genannt - werden dann fermentiert, um die noch vorhandene schleimige Schicht der Bohne zu entfernen. Nach Beendigung der Fermentation werden die Bohnen mit großen Mengen Frischwasser gewaschen, um die Fermentationsrückstände zu entfernen, wodurch große Mengen an Kaffeeabwasser entstehen. Schließlich werden die Samen getrocknet.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master roasters[COLOR_REVERT] are proficient in roasting [LINK=YIELD_PEANUTS]peanuts[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]cocoa pods[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_COFFEE_BERRIES]coffee berries[\LINK] to make [LINK=YIELD_ROASTED_PEANUTS]roasted peanuts[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_COCOA]cocoa[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_COFFEE]coffee[\LINK] out of them.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the [LINK=PROFESSION_PEANUT_ROASTER]peanut roaster[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_COCOA_ROASTER]cocoa roaster[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_COFFEE_ROASTER]coffee roaster[\LINK] profession, they are capable of turning out double the amount of either resource in the same amount of time it would take a regular colonist.[PARAGRAPH:1]Master driers can be hired in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], and they can also be [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]taught[\LINK] in a colony with a [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]college[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maîtres torrefacteurs[COLOR_REVERT] produisent deux fois plus de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]café torréfié ou cacao[COLOR_REVERT] depuis les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]grains de cafés ou fèves de cacao[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Röster[COLOR_REVERT] verarbeiten doppelt soviele [LINK=YIELD_PEANUTS]Erdnüsse[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_COFFEE_BERRIES]Kaffeebeeren[\LINK] oder [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]Kakaofrüchte[\LINK] zu gerösteten [LINK=YIELD_ROASTED_PEANUTS]Erdnüssen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_COFFEE]Kaffee[\LINK] bzw. [LINK=YIELD_COCOA]Kakao[\LINK], wie andere Kolonisten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Meister-Fermentierer können in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] rekrutiert werden, und sie können auch in einer Kolonie mit einem [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]College[\LINK] oder einer seiner Erweiterungen [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]ausgebildet[\LINK] werden.

TEXT.English: Master Potter:Master Potters
Master Potter:Master Potters

Pottery is an ancient way to store grain. In the rainy insect-ridden New World pots hold enough grain to keep settlers alive through the winter until in the spring they can finally plant their new crops. A few creative types shape imaginative vessels with decorative patterns, some merely for display. Pottery becomes a cottage art form.

Pottery lets villages store their surplus grain to get them through the hungry winter. Loading sturdy pots into wagons is a handy way to ship grain and supply food to new settlements.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Potter profession, the master can make twice as many pots in the same time as a regular colonist.
Skilled Milkmaid:Skilled Milkmaids
Skilled Milkmaid:Skilled Milkmaids
Milkmaids get milk from cows, goats, sheep and any other cooperative mammal. Their work feeds the town children, improves the taste of tea or coffee, and provides the raw material for cheesemakers.

Milkmaids work hard to deliver much-needed protein to settlers young and old. Anyone who thinks the work is easy hasn't been close enough to the business end of a cow. Milkmaids are also immune to smallpox, a rare advantage in colonial times.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Milkmaid profession, the expert can get twice the milk in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Cheese Maker:Master Cheese Makers
Master Cheese Maker:Master Cheese Makers

Cheese is produced by coagulation of the milk protein casein. Milk is usually acidified and the enzymes of either rennet or bacterial enzymes are added so the casein coagulates. Curds are then separated from the liquid whey and pressed into finished cheese.

Cheese is valued for its transportability, long shelf life, and high content of fat, protein, calcium, and phosphorus. The long storage life of some cheeses, especially when encased in a protective rind, allows selling when markets are favourable.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Cheesemaker profession, the master can get twice the weight of cheese in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Charcoal Burner:Master Charcoal Burners
Master Charcoal Burner:Master Charcoal Burners

Charcoal comes from wood cooked in a kiln over six to eight days, sometimes longer. Charcoal burns at 1,100 degrees Celsius. The melting point of iron is 1,200 degrees. By using a bellows on a charcoal fire a blacksmith can get to work.

The charcoal burner watches the smoke exiting the kiln. If the smoke is thick and grey, the wood is still raw; thin, blue smoke indicates good carbonization.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Charcoal Burner profession, the expert can get twice as much charcoal in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Baker:Master Bakers
Master Baker:Master Bakers

The baker starts work well before dawn so that households can have their daily bread. As the bakery grows, offering cookies and pastries, it becomes a social center. Some bakers even set up tables where tea is served to accompany the treats.

An efficient baker can keep prices down thanks to economies of sale. She might also offer an unparalleled variety of pastries, pies and cakes for special occasions.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Baker profession, the expert can bake twice as much in the same time as a regular colonist.
Master Powder Maker:Master Powder Makers
Master Powder Maker:Master Powder Makers

In a powder magazine well away from other buildings the powder maker mixes gunpowder from sulphur, charcoal and saltpeter: ammunition for the soldiers' guns. During colonial times it's the only available explosive (dynamite will be invented in 1867) so it's also used for artillery, mining and road building.

The powder maker needs to produce enough black powder for the soldiers' guns. Even more is needed for miners and the pioneers building roads. Black powder may be dangerous, but it's not as dangerous as having a weak army without enough ammunition.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the Powder Maker profession, the master can mix twice as much gunpowder in the same time as a regular colonist.
Mestizo:Mestizos
Mestizo:Mestizos

The mestizo is the child of a European and an Indigenous parent. Mestizo children are often rejected by both communities.[NEWLINE]Further north Metis means the same thing. Louis Riel, a Metis, is one of Canada's Fathers of Confederation, though he was hanged for treason before his contribution was recognized.
Sometimes mestizos advance in spite of of the prejudice. Quanah Parker, a mestizo born to a European mother, was known as the most terrifying Comanche leader in raids on white settlements.
Mulatto:Mulattos
Mulatto:Mulattos

The mulatto is the child of a European and an African parent, often a slave woman. The child grows up as part of the slave population. To maintain cultural separation Europeans create artificial distinctions, such as being repelled by the idea of touching Black people.

Mulattos add to the slave population but they also create cultural confusion. European women are not happy to see their husbands fathering Black babies.[NEWLINE]Because slave life expectancy on sugar plantations is three years, or twenty-one for mulattos born into slavery, plantation owners develop a racial justification for the deaths of their children.
Construction Supplies:Construction Supplies
Construction Supplies:Construction Supplies
Construction supplies is a vast category, ranging from wood and bricks to nails and forged hardware.
The carpenter needs construction supplies to work.
Brave Lieutenant:Brave Lieutenants
Brave Lieutenant:Brave Lieutenants

When younger sons aren't smart enough for the priesthood, and their father's rich enough to buy them an army commission, they start as junior officers, charging into battle at the head of their troops. Bravery gives them a fighting chance.
Brave lieutenants are rare, appearing perhaps once out of every ten battles.
Capable Captain:Capable Captains
Capable Captain:Capable Captains

The one essential quality in a capable captain is prowess: the ability to win a fight. The best strategist in the American Revolutionary army was Benedict Arnold. Unfortunately he was strategic enough to recognize that the English would probably win, so he changed to what turned out to be the losing side, and his name became a synonym for infamy.
Capable captains are front line leaders. They are rare, occurring perhaps once out of every ten battles.
Famous Actress:Famous Actresses
Famous Actress:Famous Actresses

Celebrities come at first from Europe but ultimately talent surfaces everywhere. Nonetheless plays and readings continue to rely on Old Country texts, both classical and sentimental, throughout the colonial period.

Humans are social animals, Fame brings people together to be entertained, to see and be seen. A celebrity performance attracts the entire countryside. To have a resident famous actress improves any community's reputation. Leaving a trail of broken hearts behind her, her legend grows.
Seductive Harlot:Seductive Harlots
Seductive Harlot:Seductive Harlots

Church-going ladies may look down on an honest whore but harlots often have influence with the high and mighty, including those in the church. Prostitution is as diverse as society itself. The seductive harlot might have a lucrative career but it's short. Some who like the life go into management after their peak personal earning years.

Lonely men often find happiness with a whore who also knows how to be a good listener. For the harlot herself, being in a world with five men for every woman means the chance to find her own husband instead of having her marriage arranged by her parents.
Honored Judge:Honored Judges
Honored Judge:Honored Judges
TBD
TBD
